byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

abstract: Officials say Pres Obama has narrowed his choice for nominee to fill Supreme Court vacancy down to three people; allies assert president chose candidates with bipartisan support and sterling records in order to make it difficult for Republican lawmakers to justify delaying decision, despite administration's claim that it is not considering political factors.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s decision is based purely on qualifications, White House officials insisted, though other allies cited political considerations.

headline.main: Allies Say Obama’s Court Pick Is Near, and Will Be Hard for Republicans to Ignore
headline.print_headline: Allies Say Obama’s Court Pick Is Near, and Will Be Hard for Republicans to Ignore

snippet: President Obama’s decision is based purely on qualifications, White House officials insisted, though other allies cited political considerations.
